ratings.comment: This professor was kind and accommodating, however the class itself was unorganized and extremely vague. Her grading was extremely harsh and unfair considering there was little to no explanation for the set up and prompt of the assignments. There was no explanation when a large portion of points were taken off for the essay, overall not helpful.

Nice Professor, but class was way harder than it needed to be. Discussions, papers, exams were all graded way harder than necessary. Lectures were long and boring. Tons of reading. Lectures were recorded, but powerpoints were never posted and exam answers were never released. Also could not view averages for work so hard to gage how you were doing.

Dr. Murchison was nice, but her class was way harder than it needed to be. We had a final paper that was graded really harshly and most of her comments were personal preferences we would've never known. Lectures got really boring and she never got through the content we needed because she spent time answering every question and going on tangents.

LOVED having Prof Murchison! She was super good at accommodating her students' needs. Our class expressed severe stress to her and she gave us an extra week to write our papers. She also was very good at answering any questions you had on material. Great lecturer too.

Dr. Murchison put no effort into her class whatsoever and we would repeatedly have lectures telling us 'welcome back from break' when we hadn't even had one yet. The class isn't extremely hard to get an A in, but I felt like she didn't know what she was talking about and took material straight out of the textbook. The grading was harsh.

Dr. M was extremely kind and accommodating. Responds to email super quickly. The course was designed to be online pre-COVID. All you have to do is read and discuss with your peers, a few tests, and write one quality paper. If you do the work you will have no problem. And the content was fascinating so you'll be motivated to engage with the course

Dr. M. appeared to be very lazy with this course. Classes were pre-recorded and asynchronous requiring minimal effort be done by her. The paper was introduced way too late in the paper with unclear expectations and a vague prompt. Her feedback was vague, unhelpful, and inconsistent with the grades she gave out. Readings were extensive.

Professor Murchison acts like she is very adaptable and willing to help, but her teaching style and course content says otherwise. There is one term paper which is heavily weighted and very harshly graded. She gives absolutely no kind feedback and only points out flaws. The tests are writing heavy and requires specific knowledge of the readings.

Dr. Murchison was a really harsh grader. The persuasive essay you do at the end of the semester that is worth a third of your grade is graded really harshly. The class is emotionally intense as the subject matter is really hard. She was not good at mediating this and helping to unpack these traumatizing issues.

I was so excited for this class but soon found out that Prof Murchison is really not accommodating as she lets on. The amount of reading and coursework required for a 3 credit class is insane. Also, she uses honorlock and does not tell you ahead of time. Do NOT take this class if you have reading-heavy classes. You will not have enough time.

Professor Murchinson teaches super interesting classes but is too hard. She gives bad grades after not being specific about what she wanted. The criteria for her papers are super vague, but when you try and be creative you get points deducted. If you don't give her what she wanted you will fail.
She was super unaccommodating and really rude with question asking from students. Super condensing and would not recommend.

While the classes she teachers are interesting, her expectations are way too high and not specific. She grades harshly but doesn't tell students what they get points off for or what she expects of them.

I took an online course with this professor. I would not take a course with her again. I dont know if it was simply her online teaching style, but it was awful. Very hard grader with high expectations but does not lay out what is required. You will get points off based on her expectations that have not been mentioned in syllabus.

I took this class because of the positive reviews about Melanie. I have to disagree. She is a extremely tough grader and provides little detail when it comes to grading criteria. We had a 12 page paper and she told us we could write between 10-15 pages without penalty and my friend got points off for only writing 11.

Dr. Murchison is very passionate about what she teaches, and makes lectures enjoyable and fun. She makes an effort to connect what she's teaching about to present-day issues, which really helps with overall understanding of the topics. She doesn't post her powerpoints online, so it's important to take notes.

Prof. Murchinson knows how to lead an engaging class, but she also knows how to keep you busy. There's a lot of material each week, and it's hard to keep track of. The content isn't necessarily hard -- it's just a lot of reading, videos, documentaries to watch during the week in addition to watching lecture.

Melanie was a pretty good professor. She doesn't post slides from lectures online and the textbook isn't always helpful because she goes way more in depth in class so it's hard to catch up if you skip. Class was actually interesting and she was an average grader.
Clearly knows her stuff. Tests were fair. Lectures helped with tests. She basically tells you what's on the test at the review session so definitely go. Not much homework.

I learned the most about the legal field in this class compared to any other. Lectures are a rotation of professionals who lecture for two weeks on different topics. three reflection papers due throughout the semester and a final paper. Melanie is easy to get a hold of to talk to and is knowledgeable and a fair grader. great class and professor

Melanie would stand in front of class and just page through the textbook. Slides were paragraphs long and only had the content/examples given in the book. Usually you could just read the textbook and pass, but since attendance is mandatory, you still have to go to class (such a waste of time). I was really excited for this class, but she ruined it!

She is a law professor and it shows in this sociology course. She focuses immensely on court cases and legal issues as that is what she knows best. Lectures feel as though she is reading straight from slides, and she often repeats herself. The class can be interesting though, and it isn't too challenging especially with extra credit opportunities.

I took Legal Studies 217 with Prof. Murchison last fall!  She was an awesome professor & really cared about her students.  Two in-class essays were a bit tough, but she was always ready to help and really stimulated my interest in the subject.  I'm taking another class with her this semester!

Really awesome person, very interesting and smart. Really enjoyed the topic of the class but wasn't crazy about the structure, grading is tough on papers and they are worth a lot of your grade. Not super easy to get an A, but still worth taking the class.

LS 444 is one of my favorite classes I took at UW. Only assignments were response papers that could be written in 10 minutes if need be and one oral presentation with a partner. Melanie is very accessible and hilarious. Love her and I'm taking LS400 with her currently because she's so great.

Melanie is awesome. She seems to have an answer to every possible question. Go to her office hours! Not only can she help you immensely in preparing for an exam or writing a paper, but she is genuinely cool and fun to talk to. Take a class with her if possible!

If you're not a strong writer this class might be a little tough. However, if youre interested in the material and go to office hours you can get a good grade. The class would've been much more enjoyable if we were not all cramped into a tiny classroom but thats not up to her. She tried changing it. All in all, I would recommend her. Good class!

Melanie is an amazing person, she goes above and beyond what is expected from a professor.  She is hilarious and makes lectures so much fun and makes you want to go to class.  Expect a few papers and 2 exams.  She is really good at making sure to plan exams around the usual university schedule.  I never had another exam the week that she had hers.

Legal Studies 444 was by far one of my favorite courses taken at UW. The class introduces a new topic and lecture series every 2 weeks, so you stay engaged throughout the semester. The course includes 7 response papers, 15% participation, and 15% oral presentation.

She makes power lectures interesting, and utilizes any opportunity to get the class involved. The grading is fairly clear cut, consisting of a midterm, final, 2 papers and participation/ attendance (takes lecture attendance). She's also super open to talking about ANYTHING, so go to her office hours and participate during lecture.

Class grade based on attendance and 2-3 page response papers. It's really easy and she provided a grading rubric in the syllabus. She's really interesting and intelligent and loves student participation. I really enjoy her and would definitely take another class with her.

The class consisted of one short response paper, a 15 page final paper and a group project. We were not given rubrics for any of the assignments and she was quite a tough grader. She lectured for the first half of the semester and then the rest of the classes were taken up by group projects, which got very old quickly.

As Melanie's first year, I'd say she has a lot to work out. She assigned two papers and a group presentation, but did not provide paper rubrics for so you are left in the dark as far as her expectations. Sure, you can go to office hours, but one shouldn't HAVE to go to office hours to know what she expects for a paper. Her lectures fell apart also
